be.florien.databasecomplexjoins.architecture

Class DBData<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.florien.databasecomplexjoins.architecture.DBData<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Represent an object which can be retrieved from a database
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DBPrimitiveField, DBTable

    public abstract class DBData<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a request to the database and parsing said request, making the link between the Database representation with references and the object model with classes and field containing the representation.
    Author:
    florien

    • Method Detail

      • getDataName

        public java.lang.String getDataName()
        Return the name of this field or table. In case of a DBTable, the dataName could be an alias.
        Returns:
        The name of this field or table

      • extractRowValue

        protected abstract void extractRowValue(Cursor cursor,
                   int column)
        Convert the demanded field (or the table associated if the field is a foreign ID) into an Object from the row represented with the Cursor.
        Parameters:
        cursor - The Cursor from which the selected field/table will be converted
        column - Represent the column number where the selected field/table is stored in the Cursor

      • buildProjection

        protected abstract java.util.List<java.lang.String> buildProjection(java.lang.String tableName)
        Construct and return the list of fields to be retrieved in order to make the object representation
        Parameters:
        tableName - Name of the table containing the field
        Returns:
        a list of fields' names to be retrieved

      • setComplete

        protected void setComplete()
        Notify the table that the parsing of this object is finished

      • getValue

        public T getValue()
        Get the result of the parsing if it's finished
        Returns:
        the result of the parsing or null if it's not completed

      • reset

        protected void reset()
        Reset the current DBData, allowing the parsing of a new Object
